column2: Organism
column4: A particular organism or defined group of organisms considered to be taxonomically homogeneous.

column2: organismID
column4: An identifier for the Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

column2: organismName
column4: A textual name or label assigned to an Organism instance.

column2: organismScope
column4: A description of the kind of Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether the Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

column2: associatedOccurrences
column4: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

column2: associatedOrganisms
column4: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Organisms and their associations to this Organism.

column2: previousIdentifications
column4: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous assignments of names to the Organism.

column2: organismRemarks
column4: Comments or notes about the Organism instance.

column2: Comments or notes about the Organism instance.

Instances of the Organism class are intended to facilitate linking of one or more Identification instances to one or more Occurrence instances. Therefore, things that are typically assigned scientific names (such as viruses, hybrids, and lichens) and aggregates whose occurrences are typically recorded (such as packs, clones, and colonies) are included in the scope of this class.
This term is not intended to be used to specify a type of taxon. To describe the kind of Organism using a URI object in RDF, use rdf:type (http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type) instead.
The recommended best practice is to separate the values with a vertical bar (' | ').
